question: 瞬く
sourceMnemonic:
Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>blink</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to blink</vocabulary>.

This word is generally used in the phrase 瞬く間に (in the blink of an eye).
sourceReadingMnemonic: <reading>Mah ta ta</reading> (<ja>またた</ja>) is showing, causing you <vocabulary>to blink</vocabulary>. I don't know what a "tata" is, but I bet you could come up with something that's blink-worthy.
